description: Numbers n such that (6^n + 1)/7 is a prime.
links: J. Brillhart et al., Factorizations of b^n +- 1, Contemporary Mathematics, Vol. 22, Amer. Math. Soc., Providence, RI, 3rd edition, 2002.
H. Dubner and T. Granlund, Primes of the Form (b^n+1)/(b+1), J. Integer Sequences, 3 (2000), #P00.2.7.
H. Lifchitz, Mersenne and Fermat primes field
mathematica: lst={};Do[p=(6^n+1)/7;If[PrimeQ[p], AppendTo[lst, n]], {n, 7!}];lst (* _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Sep 29 2008 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Sep 15 2000
extensions: a(12) was discovered by Kamil Duszenko, Jul 15 2003
a(13) was discovered by _Henri Lifchitz_, Sep 15 2007
a(14) was discovered by _Paul Bourdelais_, Oct 01 2007
a(15)=131891, a probable prime, was discovered by _Paul Bourdelais_, Feb 01 2010
a(16)=196337 is a probable prime discovered by _Paul Bourdelais_, Feb 19 2010
